Issues.Title: Responsive container variants don't get proper paddings set
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Responsive container variants don't get proper paddings set" (#9199)

Issues.Title: fix safelist variant key required by typings
Issues.Body: The typescript typings were requiring a `variant` key on the `safelist` object in the config. This pr fixes that. Screen shot of false positive: Docs that show `variant` key should not be required: https://tailwindcss.com/docs/content-configuration#using-regular-expressions
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix safelist variant key required by typings" (#9200)

Issues.Title: Max-width breakpoints are not work as expected
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.1.8

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
Next.js 12.2.5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v14.17.3

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/WmlTfmsWSe

**Describe your issue**

I am trying to setup max-width breakpoints according to [the article](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/screens#max-width-breakpoints). After that all of the breakpoints related classes are not working with the error 
**The `max-w-screen-xl` class does not exist. If `max-w-screen-xl` is a custom class, make sure it is defined within a `@layer` directive.**

Please correct me if I am doing something wrong.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Max-width breakpoints are not work as expected" (#9197)

Issues.Title: Fix CLI not watching atomically renamed files
Issues.Body:
Chokidar should take care of this itself but sometimes it doesn’t do so OR is otherwise very sensitive to timing problems.

Fixes #7759
Fixes #9072
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix CLI not watching atomically renamed files" (#9173)

Issues.Title: Trigger Tailwind Play update after publishing insiders build
Issues.Body: This PR updates the `release-insiders` workflow so that it triggers Tailwind Play's [`upgrade-tailwindcss`](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/play.tailwindcss.com/blob/master/.github/workflows/upgrade-tailwindcss.yml) workflow, passing the new insiders version number as an input.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Trigger Tailwind Play update after publishing insiders build" (#9191)

Issues.Title: Correct typo in `preflight.css`
Issues.Body:
<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Correct typo in `preflight.css`" (#9190)

Issues.Title: Error loading PostCSS config: Invalid PostCSS Plugin found: [0]
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "^3.1.8", 

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

PyroCMS 3.4
```
"laravel/framework": "5.5.*",
"devDependencies": {
    "autoprefixer": "^10.4.8",
    "axios": "^0.16.2",
    "bootstrap-sass": "^3.4.1",
    "cross-env": "^5.2.1",
    "jquery": "^3.4.1",
    "laravel-mix": "^1.0",
    "lodash": "^4.17.4",
    "postcss": "^8.4.16",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.1.8",
    "vue": "^2.1.10"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "node-sass": "^6.0.1",
    "select2": "^4.0.10",
    "vue-bootstrap-typeahead": "^0.2.6",
    "vue-loading-overlay": "^3.2.0",
    "vue-multiselect": "^2.1.6",
    "vue-recaptcha": "^1.3.0",
    "vue-resource": "^1.5.1",
    "vue2-dropzone": "^3.6.0"
  }
```
**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v14.7.1

**What browser are you using?**

Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows. I don't have any idea why my coworker was able to run this project smoothly without any problems. We all have the same version on package.lock, npm version & node version the only difference was he/she was using Mac.

**Reproduction URL**
N/A

**Describe your issue**
my postcss.config is empty
```
module.exports = {
  plugins: {
    tailwindcss: {},
    autoprefixer: {},
  },
}
```

When running npm run dev/watch I got this error `Error loading PostCSS config: Invalid PostCSS Plugin found: [0]` or this ` error  in ./node_modules/vue-bootstrap-typeahead/src/components/VueBootstrapTypeahead.vue`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20100579/186683450-2e1740a8-56e5-4db9-9c5b-50061343c1d7.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error loading PostCSS config: Invalid PostCSS Plugin found: [0]" (#9180)

Issues.Title: Add support for `visibility: collapse` with new `collapsed` utility
Issues.Body:
## Purpose & motivation This PR adds a new `collapsed` utility to support `visibility: collapse` which has become extremely valuable for visually hiding elements and allowing subsequent elements to take up their space without layout shift (when used in tables, flexbox, grids, etc.). ## More thought needed on naming(?) As we discussed on the Tailwind discord general channel, it may be a while before merging this so you can give more thought to the best naming for this new utility. I wanted to get the ball rolling by opening this PR so we could begin thinking on it once the Tailwind Labs team has more time for this. ## Workarounds In the meantime, for anyone else seeking to use `visibility: collapse` within their codebases, here are two workarounds you can use that work perfectly fine for the time being— ### 1️⃣ Workaround 1: adding a custom utility to your Tailwind config ```javascript addUtilities({ '.collapsed': { visibility: 'collapse', }, }); ``` ```html
``` ### 2️⃣ Workaround 2: using Tailwind's [arbitrary property syntax](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/adding-custom-styles#arbitrary-properties) ```html
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add support for `visibility: collapse` with new `collapsed` utility" (#9181)

Issues.Title: Preflight display declaration for iframe, img, etc. overrides the hidden attribute
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.1.8

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Laravel Mix 6.0.49

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.16.0

**What browser are you using?**

Verified in Chrome & Safari

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/3ETU8oj18o

**Describe your issue**

I discovered a funky edge-case today in the preflight styles. [Preflight](https://unpkg.com/tailwindcss@3.1.8/src/css/preflight.css) contains the following:
```css
/*
1. Make replaced elements `display: block` by default. (https://github.com/mozdevs/cssremedy/issues/14)
2. Add `vertical-align: middle` to align replaced elements more sensibly by default. (https://github.com/jensimmons/cssremedy/issues/14#issuecomment-634934210)
   This can trigger a poorly considered lint error in some tools but is included by design.
*/

img,
svg,
video,
canvas,
audio,
iframe,
embed,
object {
  display: block; /* 1 */
  vertical-align: middle; /* 2 */
}
```
Unfortunately that doesn't work well if any of those elements have the `hidden` attribute. Browsers implement `hidden` with `display: none`, but the Tailwind preflight class has a higher specificity and so overrides it.

I was wondering about the safest way to fix this without increasing specificity in a way that could break things. What's Tailwind's browser support policy say about using `:where()` for this kind of thing? I'm thinking that using the following structure would be ideal, but it wouldn't work on [older browsers that lack support](https://caniuse.com/mdn-css_selectors_where).

```css
iframe:not(:where([hidden])) {
  display:block;
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Preflight display declaration for iframe, img, etc. overrides the hidden attribute" (#9165)

Issues.Title: Honor the `hidden` attribute on elements in preflight
Issues.Body:
You’ll still be able to override this with utilities but this ensures that things like `<iframe hidden>` work as expected.

Fixes #9165
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Honor the `hidden` attribute on elements in preflight" (#9174)

Issues.Title: divide utility doesn't work properly when there's a <template> tag in the markup
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwind v2.2.19

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss v8.4.14, vite v2.9.13

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Node v16.15.1

**What browser are you using?**

Safari 15.6.1, Firefox 104.0

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS 12.5.1

**Reproduction URL**

https://codepen.io/greatislander/pen/VwXNqxK

**Describe your issue**

The `divide` utility uses the general sibling combinator with `:not([hidden])` to ensure that borders are only inserted between visible elements. This doesn't work when using AlpineJS [`x-for`](https://alpinejs.dev/directives/for) loops as the presence of the [(always hidden)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/template) `<template>` element before the loop items causes a border to be added to the first item in the loop.

I'd suggest that it might be worth expanding the `:not([hidden])` selector to also include `:not(template)`. I'd be happy to open a PR for this if you agree with my suggestion.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "divide utility doesn't work properly when there's a <template> tag in the markup" (#9172)

Issues.Title: Impossible to override upper-declared classes
Issues.Body:
v 3.1.3
React 17.0.2

It is currently not possible to use styles from the same object, such as `rounded-md rounded-full`, due to the hierarchy of value declarations.
It would be better if the next class with the same logic, such as rounding, overrides all previous classes.

Thanks for your work!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Impossible to override upper-declared classes" (#9161)

This can be helpful for those who started using tailwind with other frameworks using prefixes not to overlap with others and later refactored their codebase. transformed all code to tailwind. And then they need to replace/remove all prefix from classes in their codebase. as using prefix creates lots of noise in the code. and repetitive use of the prefix

Issues.Title: PostCSS doesn't work with tailwind
Issues.Body:
**Tailwind version:** 
`v3.0.23`

**Build tools:**
```
gulp: 4.0.2
gulp-postcss: 9.0.1
postcss: 8.4.16
node: 12.22.9
```

OS: Ubuntu

**Description**
I started getting this error on a project that worked fine just a couple of months ago, is this issue related to tailwind? I tried posting this over at postcss repo but I haven't received a response so far.

```
gulp-notify: [gulp error in gulp-postcss] Error in plugin "gulp-postcss"
Message:
    ENOENT: no such file or directory, stat 'src/assets/styles/style.css'
Details:
    errno: -2
    syscall: stat
    code: ENOENT
    path: src/assets/styles/style.css
    fileName: src/assets/styles/style.css

Stack:
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, stat 'src/assets/styles/style.css'
    at Object.statSync (fs.js:1016:3)
    at trackModified (node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/setupContextUtils.js:468:46)
    at Object.getContext (node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/setupContextUtils.js:858:5)
    at node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/setupTrackingContext.js:39:53
    at node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/processTailwindFeatures.js:38:11
    at plugins (node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/index.js:33:58)
    at LazyResult.runOnRoot (node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:339:16)
    at LazyResult.runAsync (node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:393:26)
    at LazyResult.async (node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:221:30)
    at LazyResult.then (node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:206:17)
```

Here's my task:

```
gulp.task("styles", function () {
  const stylesPath = PATH.assets + PATH.styles;
  return gulp
    .src(PATH.source + stylesPath + '**/*.scss') // source
    .pipe(changed(PATH.source + stylesPath + '**/*.scss')) // source
    .pipe(sourcemaps.init())
    .pipe(sass({
        includePaths: ['node_modules'],
        errLogToConsole: true,
        outputStyle: "compressed",
      }).on('error', sass.logError))
    .pipe(postcss())
    .pipe(sourcemaps.write(PATH.maps))
    .pipe(gulp.dest(PATH.build + stylesPath)) // output
    .pipe(browser.stream());
});
```

Here's my postcss config: 

```
module.exports = {
    plugins: [
        require("postcss-import"),
        require("tailwindcss"),
        require("autoprefixer"),
    ],
};
```

If I comment tailwind in `postcss.config.js` then compile works, otherwise I get the error above. Thanks in advance for any help!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PostCSS doesn't work with tailwind" (#9148)

Issues.Title: variable colors with <alpha-value> not working with theme function on plugins
Issues.Body:
I'm trying to create a plugin for Tailwind 3.1.8, but when I use variables on colors with the new syntax - `rgb(var(--primary) / <alpha-value>)` - the color stop working. 

I created an example on [https://play.tailwindcss.com/2apCJBfHdC](https://play.tailwindcss.com/2apCJBfHdC)

Removing the `/ <alpha-value>` from the color value make things work again.

I'm doing something wrong?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "variable colors with <alpha-value> not working with theme function on plugins" (#9143)

Issues.Title: Update cssnano: 5.1.12 → 5.1.13 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ✳️ cssnano (5.1.12 → 5.1.13) · [Repo](https://github.com/cssnano/cssnano) · [Changelog](https://github.com/cssnano/cssnano/blob/master/packages/cssnano/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

5.1.13 (from changelog)

Patch Changes

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Issues.Title: Arbitrary selectors do not work with the group- selector
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.1.8 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** next v12.2.4 **What browser are you using?** Firefox **What operating system are you using?** Windows **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/v4zwsTiLaY **Describe your issue** Hello, as the title says, I'm unable to use arbitrary variants with the group- selector. ```jsx
{parsed.icon}
{parsed.text}
 ``` As you can see, I'm trying to use the `[&[data-highlighted]]:` arbitrary selector, and I've added `group-` to the start of it to target the parent element. I've tested whether the `group` attribute works as intended with `group-hover` and whether the `[&[data-highlighted]]` works on it's own on the level above. Both of these work so I am sure that it's an issue with it combined together. I've also tried putting `group-` inside of the arbitrary selector such as: `[group-&[data-highlighted]]` which does not work. --- This is my first time creating a bug report like this so sorry if I messed something up 😅
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Arbitrary selectors do not work with the group- selector" (#9138)

Issues.Title: Expected a backslash preceding the semicolon.
Issues.Body: resources/css/app.css
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Expected a backslash preceding the semicolon." (#9137)

Issues.Title: Media Queries not working
Issues.Body:
Here is a set of code that isn't working due to !important on the flex class and not on the internal media query: ```
text
text 2
``` This results in flex-wrap being !important and always overriding the media query of flex-nowrap
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Media Queries not working" (#9132)

Issues.Title: --2022-08-17: not found
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

`v3.1.8` / `https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/releases/download/v3.1.8/tailwindcss-linux-x64`

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

`tailwindcss-linux-x64`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`v16.0.0`

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

Debian Testing

**Describe your issue**

```sh
wget https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/releases/download/v3.1.8/tailwindcss-linux-x64 -o ~/bin/tailwindcss
chmod +x ~/bin/tailwindcss
tailwindcss -i style/main.scss -o static/main.css --minify
```

Error output:
```
/home/user/bin/tailwindcss: 1: --2022-08-17: not found
/home/user/bin/tailwindcss: 2: Syntax error: "(" unexpected
```

`style/main.scss`
```scss
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

.background-radial-gradient {
  background-color: hsl(72, 56%, 51%);
  background-image: radial-gradient(650px circle at 0% 0%,
          hsl(72, 41%, 35%) 15%,
          hsl(72, 41%, 30%) 35%,
          hsl(72, 41%, 20%) 75%,
          hsl(72, 41%, 19%) 80%,
          transparent 100%),
  radial-gradient(1250px circle at 100% 100%,
                  hsl(72, 41%, 45%) 15%,
                  hsl(72, 41%, 30%) 35%,
                  hsl(72, 41%, 20%) 75%,
                  hsl(72, 41%, 19%) 80%,
                  transparent 100%);
}
```

`tailwind.config.js`
```js
/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
module.exports = {
  content: ["./**/*.html"],
  theme: {
    extend: {},
  },
  plugins: [
    require('@tailwindcss/forms'),
    require('@tailwindcss/typography'),
  ],
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "--2022-08-17: not found" (#9123)

Issues.Title: Tailwind CSS v2.x doesn't work with CRA TypeScript
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v2.2.16

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
create react app (Typescript)
"autoprefixer": "^9.8.7",
"postcss": "^7.0.38",
postcss7-compat@^2.2.16
craco: "^6.1.1",

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v14.x

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome, Edge, Safari

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Describe your issue**
I have an old project with create react app, I installed TailwindCss v2.2.16 as this docs https://v2.tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/create-react-app

But styles/classes don't apply to my project. I have tried to search here, stackoverflow... tried many other ways but it doesn't work. So I hope you can help me there. Below are my config files:

**package.json**

```
{
  "name": "web-frontend",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.13.14",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.13.12",

```
module.exports = {
  purge: ['./src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}', './public/index.html'],
  darkMode: 'class', // or 'media' or 'class'
  important: true,
  theme: {
    inset: {
      '-22': '-5.5rem',
      '-999': '-999em'
    },
    backgroundColor: {
      'twitter': '#00acee',
      'sameBg': '#f0f2f5',
      "darkBg": '#19191a',
      "darkSection": '#242525',
      "darkArrow": '#3a3a3a',
      "darkDialog": '#272727',
      'footerNavActive': '#323232'
    },
    textColor: {
      'darkText': "#e8edf2"
    },
    gradientColorStops: {

      'purple-logo': '#7e3bfd',
      'pink-logo': '#df67fd',
      "darkSection": '#242525',
    },
    zIndex: {
      '60': 60,
      '8888': 8888,
      '9999': 9999,
      '99999': 99999,
      '10k': 999999
    },
    flex: {
      '50': '42%',
      '700': '1 1 700px',
      '400': '0 0 400px',
      '11a': '1 1 auto',
      '0024': '0 0 24px'

    },
    width: {
      '400px': '400px',
      '500px': '500px',
      '26': '6.6rem',
      '22': '5.7rem',
      'videoFeed': '400px',
      'videoFeedIP': '335px'
    },

      'musicText': '15rem',

    },

      'videoFeed': '40rem'
    },
    boxShadow: {
      'box': '0 2px 4px #e9edf0',
      'none': 'none',
    },
    borderColor: theme => ({
      ...theme('colors'),
      'footerNav': '#e5e7eb',
    }),

      gridTemplateRows: {

      }

    },
  },
  variants: {
    extend: {
      borderWidth: ['dark', 'first'],
      borderColor: ['dark'],
      boxShadow: ['dark'],
      divideColor: ['dark'],
      display: ['dark'],
      opacity: ['dark', 'disabled'],
      inset: ['dark'],
      borderOpacity: ['active'],
    },
    scrollbar: ['dark']
  },
  plugins: [
    require('tailwind-scrollbar')
  ],
}

                require('tailwindcss'),
                require('autoprefixer'),
            ],

...

**index.css** has been import these and index.js also import this index.css file
```
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;
```

Thank you for your help
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind CSS v2.x doesn't work with CRA TypeScript" (#9118)

Issues.Title: Fix `@apply` selector rewriting when multiple classes are involved
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes two problems when using `@apply`:

1. Incorrect placement of element selectors when multiple classes are joined in a selector

Given:
```css
.foo.bar { color: red; }
section { @apply bar; }
```

We would naively replace the .bar portion with `section` producing `.foosection` which is obviously wrong. This did _not_ happen when applying `foo` because this simple replacement produced something that happened to be correct `section.bar`.

2. ~Only replacing the first occurrence of a candidate in a selector:~ (reverted due to this not being 100% correct either)

Given:
```css
.foo + .foo { color: red; }
section { @apply foo; }
```

We would produce:
```css
section + .foo { color: red; }
```

This is not correct because the `foo` class may not even _exist_ at all if `.foo + .foo` is defined in the `components` or `utilities` layers.

Fixes #9093
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix `@apply` selector rewriting when multiple classes are involved" (#9107)
